lexUnit.name: belt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a strip of leather or other material worn around the waist to support or hold in clothes or to carry weapons.

sentence.text: As soon as she winds her black belt around her waist , however , her personality undergoes a remarkable change .
She buckled a stiff hard belt around Alexandra 's waist and stood back to admire the effect .
Juliet Avery adjusted the belt around her slim waist .
The new farmsteads were being built at the same time , set snugly into shelter belts of oak , beech and elm , nursed up by Scots pines .
For your comfort you 'll find a padded hip belt with lumbar support , a wide angle stand for easy loading and a removable pouch for toys , nappies and the kitchen sink .
Her petticoat fell next ; then the cami-knickers ; after that the suspender belt with its four suspenders clicking in their release .
The huge man whose belly flowed over his belt and seemed to cascade down the front of his trousers pointed with the cane .
He fingered the dials upon a small black box which hung at his belt .
He 'd just about made it by the time Private Boyd had strapped my gun belt on and issued me with a plastic face visor which fitted with adjustable straps at the back .
Then he loosens Dixie 's money belt .
He had left his sword belt and dagger in the tavern .
He shaved , changed his doublet , put on his sword belt and took his heaviest cloak from its hook outside the buttery .
The zip gaped open an inch at his waist , which was cinched in far too tightly by a fake crocodile belt .
He unclipped his shield belt and slung it over his shoulder .
He was wearing a pair of his customary white trousers and a plain white shirt , rolled back to the elbows , with a black belt at his waist and a pair of shiny black shoes .
A well-fitting sack allows the load to be balanced between the shoulder harness and the hip belt without putting a strain on your shoulders or arms .
She wrapped her raincoat around her , tying the belt tightly .
She defined the waist with a wide black leather belt , studded with silver .
She always had on a brown cotton smock which was pinched in around the waist with a wide leather belt .
The girl touched the leather belt round my waist .
Her waist was pinched by a broad black belt pulled tight by leather thongs .
Ruane took a key from his pocket that was fastened to his waist belt by a fine chain .
Claudia dressed in a dark green cotton dress clasped round her slender waist with a broad yellow belt , drank a cup of coffee and opened her neglected post .
She had a tiny lace suspender belt under the camiknickers and the elasticated straps of the suspender belt peeped out , fore and aft , to hold up peach silk stockings .
He took his belt off and started whacking Chrissie with it .
Andrew 's taken my belt off .
If Third World countries are to tighten their belts , then their governments have to be prepared for trouble , because starving people get desperate .
She swallowed convulsively , and tightened the belt of her Burberry , turning up the collar as if she was preparing to weather a blizzard before closing numb fingers round the hand-grip of her bag .
It is advisable to wear a weight-training belt for this exercise because of the strain on the lower back .
Peter shrugged on his second sleeve and began to button himself up , collar neat , belt buckled .
His thumb rubbed sensuously along the swollen lower lip while his other hand undid his belt buckle .
Jimmy went back to his conversation with the tattooed man , his thumb now resting casually in Sean 's belt loop .
He was thicker set , with a suspicion of belly overhanging the crocodile belt ; his sandy hair had been fashionably crew-cut and he wore glasses .
The suspender belt was tight around her waist .
